result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Juarez

9:43 AM Defendant David C Juarez in court.  Attorney Samuels on behalf of Grant Ian Henderson in court for David C Juarez.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense indicates that a new attorney will be appointed.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

11:07 AM Defendant David C Juarez in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David C Juarez.  Attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense moves to withdraw as counsel as defendant requests to represent himself.
Defendant states he is requesting another public defender and does not want to represent himself.
Defense counsel states he is willing to withdraw and SPD will have another attorney within the office be appointed for defendant.
BTC: Motion to withdraw granted.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits on arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:38 AM Defendant David C Juarez in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David C Juarez.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Atty Henderson indicates the defendant wishes to proceed pro se
Motion hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BTC: Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David C Juarez
Current: 710 Racine St, Racine, WI 53403   (Effective: 07-20-2022)
Prior: 1017 Villa Street, Racine, WI 53403
Warrant was not sent anywhere - held on Intake clerk's desk.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David C Juarez in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David C Juarez. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
warrant held on intake clerk's desk to see if defendant appears for his STC on CC calendar 07-29 at 2pm.
